abstract.text: Returns a format style to format measurement units.

inlineContent.text: The width — such as full names or abbreviations — with which to present units.
The contextual usage of the measurement unit, such as whether a length measurement applies to a road distance or a person’s height.
The format style with which to format the numeric part of the measurement.
A format style that formats measurements according to the given parameters.
Use the dot-notation form of this type method when the call point allows the use of
. You typically do this when calling the
The following example creates an array of
values that represent distances measured in kilometers. It then uses
and the format style provided by this method to format the distances. The style specifies the
usage to keep the formatted measurements in kilometers. Without this, a non-Metric locale such as the US would convert the kilometers to a locale-appropriate unit, such as miles.

code: let distances = rawDistances.map { Measurement(value: $0, unit: UnitLength.kilometers) }

abstract.text: Returns a format style to format temperature units.
Returns a format style to format measurement units.
